page.title: 16ST.EDWARD'S CH.EGGBUCKLAND
page.content: A church was first built here in Saxon times. {King Edward} of the West Saxons (975-978) gave his name to it. The church standing today was built in 143O. During the Civil War, (1642-1646) the church was vandalised by Oliver Cromwell's soldiers. It was repaired in 1864. More restoration was done in 1959 after the Second World War. The present Vicar is the Reverend Charles Whitfield - the 44th. The parish is much smaller now than in former times, but its population has increased to 14,OOO. Three services are held each Sunday and major festivals are remembered e.g. Christmas, Good Friday and Ascension Day. In the past year there were 4O weddings and 4O funerals. 53 babies were baptised.
